website_summaries.verdict: Your cat will fall in love with this soft, easy-to-digest, and protein-packed pate made from high quality beef and chicken.
pros: Deboned beef, beef broth, chicken liver, and deboned chicken are the first 4 ingredients
Soft pate texture is great for picky eaters
cons: Since the Purrfect Bistro brand contains excellent ingredients, it is a fairly expensive recipe

customer_reviews.title: Recent Quality Problems - Beware
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this Merrick 5.5oz Chicken Pate for years through Amazon, however Merrick's quality control has significantly declined recently. In the last few weeks our 7yr old cat started having stomach problems and was admitted to a veterinary hospital for vomiting. No other symptoms or illness. Tonight we opened a can from the same case to find a dead fly in the food (see pictures). It would appear other reviewers in the last few weeks have also complained of sick cats and quality control issues with cans expiring in 2019. I've loved Merrick for years, but I feel compelled to let others know about my recent purchase experience. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received Moldy Product - Check The Food
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this cat food for years and this is the first time this happened. I received my order yesterday and this is the first can from the batch. I scooped out the cat food and noticed weird coloring. From the looks of it I believe it is mold. I have requested a return and am asking for a replacement batch. Hopefully this is just something screwy with one can but I would recommend owners checking their cans. Hopefully Amazon will replace the cans and I can update my review after I have scrutinized a new batch. Please check your cans, I would hate for anyone's cat to get sick!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Bleh and yuck, from my cat...
customer_reviews.text: Merrick was bought by Purina and the formula changed, according to my cat and articles that I have read. More importantly, the food, particularly the beef pate, smells horrible, sometimes like feces. I mean real feces. I'm changing brands without even finishing this product. It's a shame since it used to be a decent brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dawne Belloise

customer_reviews.title: ****DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT***
customer_reviews.text: ****DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT***. I purchased 24 cans for my foster kittens who love the product, which I normally purchase at my local pet store. Figured I would purchase from Amazon and save a few dollars. Well, the product was MOLDING with white and green mold on the inside and I only realized after feeding my foster kittens for two days (About 4 cans). They became ill (vomiting/diarrhea). Amazon refunded me but that does nothing to help my now sick foster kittens / the mess that it has now created.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa N. Piltz

customer_reviews.title: Bulged cans - A sign of contamination
customer_reviews.text: Received a case of the rabbit type today and one of the cans was buldged out which is a sign of bacterial contamination. I don’t think I can trust this brand any longer.
customer_reviews.author: AHC

customer_reviews.title: I opened a can and it looked rotten.. ...
customer_reviews.text: I opened a can and it looked rotten....black food vs the brownish normal color of cat food. I will never purch this again. Here is the photo.
customer_reviews.author: EBW

customer_reviews.title: Bad Cans in Shipment
customer_reviews.text: I have been ordering this product for several years, because it is the only canned cat food my cat will eat. In my last order, about 1 out of 3 cans were bad: the meat was white-ish, and in these cases, my cat would eat some of it, and then throw up. So I have had to throw many cans out. I would like to continue to order this brand, but now I am skeptical of the quality of the orders I receive. I could order from the pet store, but Amazon has the better price. This savings is cancelled out when I have to throw so many cans away.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Exploded in shipping
customer_reviews.text: My kitten really likes this food. Unfortunately the box got damaged in shipping and a can got pierced. Smelled like rotting garbage when we picked up the box and we were gagging. It had exploded essentially, with rotting cat food over 3 cans, and little bugs had made their way in the box. Gross! Not sure we will buy it online again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Formula Changed? Can Changed. Cats won’t eat it.
customer_reviews.text: As a further update, I thought that Merrick’s had gone away from grain free. That is not the case. They had moved some of the language on the label. With that said my cats still won’t eat it and I remain disappointed. Like others i have seen a recent change. My cats loved this, but the past couple of months I noticed black stuff in the cans. Now they changed the can and I guess the recipe. Whatever is in the new cans smells and looks different. My cats won’t eat. Also amazon won’t allow a return, so I have something love 30 cans at around $2 to $4 a piece that my cats won’t eat.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: You owe me a can seller!
customer_reviews.text: My cats appeared to be enjoying this cat food since we've started testing out different brands and proteins bc of my cats' digestive issues. The one thing that irked me is that I received ONE can that was empty yet sealed shut. QA missed that one which is bothersome since this cat food isn't cheap and my cats can only tolerate soft food.
customer_reviews.author: Clawles

customer_reviews.title: After 8 years of Using - now makes cats very sick
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what Purina has done, but now my cats turned their nose up. I thought they were bored with it, but when they finally ate it, an hour later they both projectile vomited up. Neighbor also long term merrick fan just had to go to emergency vet because toy breed dog started vomiting uncontrollably. Found out that bought by purina and class action lawsuit because unidentfied chinese ingredients found in food. Purina ruined this great food.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeCookies

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it. Company responds fast to complaints.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. Occasionally I get a box with dented cans but i complain and they send me a new one. Very happy with company service. Also food quality. I dont think it smells much but maybe I’m just used to it.
customer_reviews.author: opinionated consumer

customer_reviews.title: New can material can be a big change for cats - but new foot seems more consistent.
customer_reviews.text: The latest cans that showed up were aluminum (different material than before)... one of our cats won’t eat it... one clearly prefers old can. Update! Cats now like the new food and they seem to enjoy it more consistently than old packaging style. The new can rinses more easily... so I've been converted.
customer_reviews.author: Joel J. Schmelzle

customer_reviews.title: Found STAPLES in food.  Twice.
customer_reviews.text: What else is there to say? Two different cans in the same pack contained metal staples. Cat loves the stuff, but this is completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Merrick Product.
customer_reviews.text: I really love Merrick products. Unfortunately this product made my cat have the runs and vomit. I don't know if this means that Merrick quality is falling, or it is just a sensitivity on the part of my cat. I can't say for certain, so I am giving it a neutral rating. I hope that others have more positive experience. I will continue to buy other Merrick products so long as we have no problems. As far as wet food for my cat however, I have switched to Purina Grain Free options. (both are now produced by Purina)>
customer_reviews.author: Panda BearTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Old food?
customer_reviews.text: Food looked old. The color and texture were different from when we buy it in the store. The food was darker and contained a lot more liquid in the cans. The labels were a little faded compared to cans we bought at the store. Very disappointed. Will not order again.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: something fishy with this food....
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Good product....if you BUY FROM THE LOCAL STORE! CONS: Cans dented and food suspect - cats turned their nose up at it most of the time. NOTES: I feed my cast this brand all the time, but normally buy from local pet store. I bought some online to save money but I think the food was not properly stored or something. I was afraid my cats would get sick so I will never be buying cat food on line again.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE Merrick Purrfect Bistro and thrive on it too
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE Merrick Purrfect Bistro and thrive on it too. Chicken pate and turkey pate the only product I feed them since they were 8 week old kittens. Now they are both3 1/2 years old and incredibly healthy, fit and active. I credit it largely to Merrick Purrfect Bistro. Remember, domestic cats are obligate carnivores because of their inherited needs. Over generations, cats have lost the ability to manufacture amino acids and vitamins like herbivores and omnivores can; they get these from the MEAT they eat. Dry food (kibble) just doesn't do the trick. You need to feed them MEAT and only MEAT for best health.
customer_reviews.author: SkyKingCFI

customer_reviews.title: Gave my cats food poisoning
customer_reviews.text: I've been noticing quality issues that I, at the time, didn't think much of until my cats got sick. Now thinking about what I'd seen, there was definitely mold and undercooked wet food. I thought I was just imagining things but I wasn't. This is unacceptable. People have clearly been complaining for years about the quality control and Purina has done nothing to fix their (formerly Merrick) brand. My cats threw up all day and couldn't eat. I'm furious! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Supora

customer_reviews.title: Bad handling, cans came broken and food spilled
customer_reviews.text: Some of the cans came open and the food was spilled inside the package. As much as I trust the brand, I can't trust the quality of this order because the content came open since who knows when.
customer_reviews.author: stefaniamarron

customer_reviews.title: ALLERGY ALERT! THEY CHANGED RECIPE
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that the formula has been changed to include chicken. There was no notice of this change on the amazon listing but for some reason I felt compelled to look at ingredient list before ordering again. This change is dangerous for cats like mine who are allergic to poultry. I called merrick to confirm that as of Oct 2019 the change was made in chanegrecipe.
customer_reviews.author: AlleyCat

customer_reviews.title: Recent formula change - my cats won't eat it
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved this food for years and then about a month ago they lost all enthusiasm for it. Some won't touch it and some just pick at it, but nobody is cleaning their plates. I would normally think my cats are just picky jerks, except for the many other reviews lately saying the same thing. Something seems to have changed and I won't be purchasing any more.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Cans were dented
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this before and have been happy, but in this last order, all but three of the cans were dented, some quite badly. Not sure if the seller can control that or was aware, since there was plastic around the case, but I don't see how nearly the whole case could be that way unintentionally. The price was no better than the pet store, though, so I didn't expect to receive a case of seconds. Maybe it's okay to use the dented cans, but since there's a possibility of contamination, I'm not comfortable feeding it to my cats. As for the food, though, they absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: annieb8833

customer_reviews.title: This was purchased for a cat with food allergies on ...
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a cat with food allergies on an elimination diet. We were starting with rabbit. Since she is not reacting to the dry rabbit I purchased this for a canned treat. I should have read all ingredients. This is not just rabbit it also has chicken. Had to take her back to the vet because of allergic reaction. At least me now know she is allergic to chicken.
customer_reviews.author: katheine heinz

customer_reviews.title: Three out of three cats love the food!
customer_reviews.text: We have three, very large cats. Overtime, I purchase from every brand locally available (about 15 brands) and within each brand I try every type of food offered. I include what I call junk food (which of course, they love) to expensive varieties at over $2.00 a can. Two out of three cats have to like the food, otherwise never purchase again. Within a month, my cats may end up eating 20 varieties. By far, Merrick Duck Pate is always a great winner. All three cats quickly clean their bowls. I now feed them the Merrick duck pate every fourth day, interspersed with a continuous variety.
customer_reviews.author: silvertips 1000

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising.
customer_reviews.text: Our cats loved this food in the 5 ounce can size. I bought the 3ounce size thinking there would be no difference. They wouldn’t even try it. We tried another can of same batch and had the same result. Obviously not the same recipe as the 5 ounce can. I feel this is misleading and a waste of $30.00. Beware of this if you order this product.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Coy

customer_reviews.title: Dented, unusable cans.
customer_reviews.text: While I love this product, I would not purchase it here. We have had this product on a subscription order and the last two orders we received, many of the cans were badly dented. Some of the cans were dented to the point that the top had popped off of the can and they were not usable. At first, we thought it was just a one time thing. It has happened again on the very next delivery. So what money you may have saved purchasing here goes right into the trash can. It's a shame because I like the convenience but not a the cost of an unusable product.
customer_reviews.author: Reta Martin

customer_reviews.title: This food is rotten / do not hurt your pets with it
customer_reviews.text: Something is wrong with this cat food since it has new packaging and the company was sold. My cats ate it for 5 years, and now my cats will not. It arrives with dented cans all the time. This food is poison.
customer_reviews.author: coco

customer_reviews.title: and they absolutely love it. However
customer_reviews.text: LOOK CLOSELY BEFORE FEEDING TO YOUR CATS!!! I've been feeding my cats the 5.5oz cans from Merrick for the past 5 months, and they absolutely love it. However, I accidentally bought the 3oz cans of the tuna pate (because they were listed with similar prices... which actually makes it almost twice as expensive than the 5.5oz cans!). I opened up two cans and noticed the odour of the food was a lot stronger than usual. When I used a fork to scoop the food out, there were bits of green and brown. Definitely threw the cans out and got a refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Mui

customer_reviews.title: Saved our kitten...
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten has IBD and suffered from diarrhea for her entire little life. Switched to this stuff and it's been 6 months, no issues. 08/04/2014 - sad to see the price jump and loss of prime shipping. Found it online at another retailer for a much lower price and free shipping. If it comes back on prime at it's normal price, I will buy from here again.
customer_reviews.author: Fuze

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Substandard food item disguised as perfect. Items opened....dated 2021 exp. Found little donut holes in food, as if the can was incompletely filled...food had become shrunken in can and was browned around the edges as if compromised by heat or freezing. Cats would NOT eat it and after several cans like this, decided the whole case (money and time wasted) needed to be diposed of.
customer_reviews.author: gal3

customer_reviews.title: ... allergies which caused let lower lip to swell up like she had fake lips
customer_reviews.text: Our Scottish Gold cat has food allergies which caused let lower lip to swell up like she had fake lips. The vet said to put her in a diet of wet and dry rabbit. We tried several other brands which she would not eat but she loves the Merrick Rabbit Recipe, the lip swelling is gone and we are very pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Man

customer_reviews.title: Good Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes this food which has a medium firm pate texture. I like the ingredients. Rory is a senior and has stopped eating dry food, so I'm hoping that a higher calorie kitten food will help to maintain his weight. I'm not sure whether this actually has more calories, but kitten food usually does. Definitely a bit more expensive than the cheaper cat foods, but worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: happyann

customer_reviews.title: Putrid, horrible, disgusting smell
customer_reviews.text: We have ordered the larger can size for our cat for several years. I ordered this size by mistake. We thought..ok, we’ll go with it. This morning I noticed a weird smell in the packaging and I took the cans outside a washed them. My husband opened one of the cans and it was the most horrible putrid smell that filled our house. We quickly took out the trash and opened windows and we still smell it. Horrible. It could be one off, but I am submitting a complaint based on the other reviews. I love my cat and don’t want to poison her.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Claire

customer_reviews.title: None of my cats would eat this
customer_reviews.text: My cats like the Merrick beef flavor but none of the fish flavors. We used to give our cats Fancy Feast Savory Centers and they LOVED it. Savory Centers is temporarily not available due to COVID-19 related problems so we had to find another food for our 6 cats. Some of them are fish only kind of guys but this fish didn't do it.
customer_reviews.author: ArtistSB

customer_reviews.title: Vile
customer_reviews.text: Just look at the pictures. These cans were delivered just a few days ago and I opened these 2 this morning and just look. I will never use this food again or ever buy Merrick pet food again.
customer_reviews.author: Magic Morningstar

customer_reviews.title: Different product!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same product that I buy from my local pet stores... Label, can, lid and product itself are all different. The jury is still out as to whether or not my picky cat will eat it. Not sure why they change the recipe, however I’m headed back to my local store in hopes that they still have the original products
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Something has gone terribly wrong in QC
customer_reviews.text: Have wasted an entire case of this food, as well as the chicken. The turkey, surf and turf, and duck flavors don't seem to be affected (yet) and it'll be a dark day if/when those are no good. Have about half a case of each beef and chicken left that none of my four cats will touch. It must be bad or smell very wrong to them; with four cats it's hard for NOONE to be in the mood for beef or chicken for weeks. Especially since they used to prefer it! My cases were purchased in November 2015. I don't even want to donate the food in case it is defective in some way!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: One can destroyed
customer_reviews.text: One can somehow popped off the edges inside the packaging and its contents exposes to air. Cat food being expensive enough as is... losing one can to damage and subsequently rot....was not enjoyable. Its especially hard to find something my cats like. Picky buggers.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Eby

customer_reviews.title: Smell and texture changes made cat throw up
customer_reviews.text: This shipment stunk, smelled different than all my previous orders. My cats smelled it gagged and threw up before even eating it. I’m very disappointed cause I e been feeding Merrick for many years...these changes esp smell is awful and I couldn’t get a refund so money thrown away. I’m very disappointed with Merrick. Shopping other brands now after many years with Merrick....terrible service for an expensive line of cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Will never purchase this again through amazon
customer_reviews.text: This was my first purchase from Amazon of Merrick wet cat food. I should have known better after reading the reviews. Every can was extremely dented and the food was dried up. Amazon did refund me my money without hesitation. I will never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: m.s.

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch?
customer_reviews.text: My two cats loved this brand and flavor. With the latest order received, they won't touch it. I don't know if it's all bad, but I've tried multiple cans with another kind they like in between. No, they won't eat it. I'm tossing 2 cases, over $60 of food, so I won't take a chance buying any more of this. I see that I'm not the only one who's seen this, and the overall ratings have come down over time, so I guess Merrick's quality isn't as good as it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Cans badly damaged
customer_reviews.text: Most shipments of this cat food have been fine. In this one 8 of 24 cans were significantly dented, though no seals were broken. Some were dented on a side, others the rim was bent out of shape. These cans would NOT have been on an shelf in a retail store. I did not return them because I needed the cans for my cats, but I am disappointed in the handling of the product somewhere along the line.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Kitty threw up after eating it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how to review this fairly, since it's a bit of a subjective item. I tried giving my two cats a can and they wouldn't go near it at first. Eventually one got hungry enough to eat a small amount but then later on he threw it up which was a bit concerning. I'm wondering if maybe I got a bad batch or maybe they just didn't like the change. Either way I guess I should rate it based on their reaction, since their opinion matters the most in this situation, so the one star is from my kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This canned food activated my cat’s allegies. It’s not what I ordered, and cannot be returned for some unstated reason.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S. Sepich

customer_reviews.title: BOOTLEG!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. My cat only ate this brand and flavor (duck pate), until recently it made him vomit and would not touch. The texture and color of the food did look different, and the packaging is also noticeably different. We’ve purchased the same thing from PetSmart which my cat had no problem with. This seems to be a bootleg version of the original Merrick.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Kim

customer_reviews.title: my cats love this
customer_reviews.text: Merrick is a great product with real ingredients in it. i usually buy a case of this which is a little expensive, but i love my cats and expense is worth it cause it is something they like. i just ordered another one i really love Merrick i would not buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Mcdermott

customer_reviews.title: Fur Children - Not This Flavor
customer_reviews.text: I did not hate the tuna pate. My kids usually love this product, but I put the tuna pate on the floor and they sniffed it, looked up at me as if to say "are you kidding"? and walked away. I have a case of this stuff.....Oh well!
customer_reviews.author: Ailurophile

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to note this is only a 3 oz can, not 5.5 like on other sites.
customer_reviews.text: The food is fine. My kittens seem to like it enough. But I made the mistake of thinking I was getting 24 5.5 oz cans for this price. On another site, the price was only a few dollars more for the 5.5 oz cans, instead of the 3 oz I got from this seller. I know it was my own mistake, not reading the description well, but this price is outrageous for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Rosas

customer_reviews.title: ... our cat be fed only non-seafood wet food and recommended two brands - both of which he said he ...
customer_reviews.text: Our veterinarian suggested (after an incident involving kidney stones) that our cat be fed only non-seafood wet food and recommended two brands - both of which he said he regularly feeds his own cat. Merrick was one of those brands. Our veterinarian does not sell Merrick products - he had no financial bias in recommending the Merrick brand. While our cat was never a 'fan' of wet foods, she took readily to the Merrick foods. She favors the pate formulas and eagerly eats the beef, duck, turkey and chicken pates every day. It's been six months - she continues to be healthy and enjoys her Merrick pates.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cats need meat!
customer_reviews.text: Cats are obligate carnivores and I feed my cats a meat-only, grain-free diet. After much research I started with Merrick and have been very pleased plus my cats love it! I was buying Merrick in the pet store but now I can buy it for less money on Amazon, and it is delivered right to my doorstep in two days (Prime). My cats are absolutely thriving on a meat-only diet and are extremely healthy, fit and trim, and Merrick seems ideal. Dry food is too heavy on the carbs and calories, and contains grain. Weight control in cats and dogs is critical. Overfeeding is "killing with kindness."
customer_reviews.author: SkyKingCFI

customer_reviews.title: Contains CHICKEN
customer_reviews.text: So this is probably on me, but I thought maybe this canned food was going to be chicken-free. The vet has suggested one of my cats might be allergic to a protein, so since they mostly eat foods containing chicken, I'm trying to switch to a chicken-free diet. My other cat is allergic to corn, so that means I'm trying to find chicken-free, corn-free food. The third and fourth ingredients in this canned food are chicken. :( I guess I'll donate it to a farm nearby that has farm kitties.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: cats would not eat
customer_reviews.text: I have four cats and none of them would touch this. One even tried to cover it up with a paper towel; all cat owners know what that means.
customer_reviews.author: goldendog

customer_reviews.title: Cats still like the taste after almost a year, and are happy and healthy!
customer_reviews.text: My two cats had been eating a different brand (Wellness) for years, and both suddenly stopped liking it. Back to the drawing board, I guess - so I purchased five different alternative brands of highly rated canned cat food (all made with chicken or turkey, and grain-free) for them to try and Merrick Purrfect Bistro was the winner! I've been using it for almost a year now as their primary food, and both cats still seem excited whenever a can is opened (certain other brands, they would sniff and walk away). They also both seem happy and healthy with soft fur and got rave reviews at their last vet appointment. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Madjoy

customer_reviews.title: Good kitten food, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have a kitten and an adult cat. This food is for the kitten, but the cats like to trade bowls about halfway through their meals. Both seems to really like the food, it all gets eaten. What I don't like is how firm it is compared to the adult version of Purrfect Bistro. More than once I've tried to mash it with a spoon and more than once it shoots out from underneath it and if I'm lucky only hits the side of the bowl. Overall I think it's good food for the price.
customer_reviews.author: MET

customer_reviews.title: Makes my cat sick--just this flavor, just this order.
customer_reviews.text: Something is wrong with the latest batch of this flavor. Opened a can and my cat puked after a few bites. Tried again for the next three days, same result. She has never had a problem with any Merrick can before and continues to eat the chicken flavor now with no issue. I want to get my money back, don't want to donate! Help?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Positive changes with this Rabbit diet formula
customer_reviews.text: I read a review where an incontinent cat did much better after being on rabbit diet. My cat has diabetes and he's around 15 years old. He hasn't used the cat box when he needs to urinate for months. After 2 weeks of being on the rabbit diet he is now using the box!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great brand
customer_reviews.text: This is the only food my sphynx kitten eats. The brand is very trustworthy and it has never givin her an upset tummy. She will continue to stay in the kitten brand till she's one.
customer_reviews.author: Nila86

customer_reviews.title: The kittens loved it, but I had a difficult time getting ...
customer_reviews.text: The kittens loved it, but I had a difficult time getting it out of the can. It's a drier cat food than I am accustomed too. The kittens seemed to like it though and seem healthy on it.
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: Our finicky cats seem to like this Merrick flavor.
customer_reviews.text: A lady at Petco told me that her and her co-workers decided that Merrick is their best cat food. With wet food it's always a crap shoot because each batch is different and you never know when the case or can you bought got the batch of bad fish that was processed into it, the one that makes your cats turn their noses up and probably rightly so. That being said, we have generally been very happy with this flavor for our two finicky cats. Amazon's delivered price is good with our free Prime shipping too, though Petco does give some outrageous online deals quite frequently as well. It always pays to shop around!
customer_reviews.author: stryder

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!!! THEY CHANGED THE RECIPE, NAME, LABEL AND INGREDIENTS!
customer_reviews.text: WARNING!!! THEY CHANGED THE RECIPE, LABEL AND INGREDIENTS! We didn't know they changed the recipe, tweaked the label, changed the name, and the ingredients are not quite the same. Our cat wouldn't touch this! This puts in a predicament trying to get her to eat now. We have to find a new cat food and you know how picky cats are when you change things up for them. Very stressful for our cat and ourselves. Our cat died 5 days later because we could not get her to eat anything. She was use to the 'old recipe' and wouldn't touch anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Servants Heart from WI

customer_reviews.title: My fussy cat only eats paté
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. One only eats freeze dried food and kibble, the other eats canned food and kibble. I discovered the cat that eats canned food only likes paté... he won't eat anything with chunks in it. It took me a while to discover this but now he isn't turning his nose up anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Artzy

customer_reviews.title: Good Cat food
customer_reviews.text: We have an old (18 years) cat. She is a very picky eater. She eats this without complaint. At her age, she gets what she eats and is a happy healthy friend! By the way - she says the taste is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great Food -- Frustrating Can
customer_reviews.text: Great Food -- Frustrating Can. This is one of the few foods my cat has consistently liked for more than 2 months. Unfortunately, my cat eats less than 3 oz at any given feeding, and the standard plastic lids I find at Petco and other pet stores do not fit these 3 oz cans -- they are slightly too small! Merrick has offered to look into making lids that will fit their 3 oz can, so obviously they are aware of this issue. I suggested they make their 3 oz cans the same size as just about every other 3 oz can that is out there, allowing it to match the standard lids that are made.
customer_reviews.author: catluvr

customer_reviews.title: and the fact it's grain free is especially good! But the price keeps going up
customer_reviews.text: Kitty loves the food varieties you guys offer, and the fact it's grain free is especially good! But the price keeps going up. Thus the one star knock off. Been buying from Merrick for a few months now and noticed the changes, and Prime members seem to be paying more. Not real sure what's up with that but it'd be nice if these weren't issues. Otherwise it's good quality food, and I'm happy with the food itself.
customer_reviews.author: CassandraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: High quality, canned meat cat food that my cats relish! Because my cats also receive dry food, my veterinarian, a cat veterinarian, told me to mix a can of cat food with a half can of water to ensure my guys get enough water in their diet, and they slurp this mixture up with enthusiasm. She told me to stick to the poultry flavors; my cats prefer the chicken pâté, so going forward, that is what I will purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzu

customer_reviews.title: Merrick cat food
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my cat did not like the food I ordered on line. I bought it at Petco first and my cat seemed to like it so I bought on line and he did not eat it, gave it to the stray cats.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde K

customer_reviews.title: Qualaity is good and our cats usually scarf it down
customer_reviews.text: Like most people with cats we spend time and effort finding foods that they will eat. I like Merrick products for their quality. Most of the time our cats eat this food with gusto, but there are days when I get a clear message that one or another is not happy with what I put out. I will keep using Merrick pet foods as we see no problems with diarrhea, overall nutrition, etc., and we know that the ingredients are nutritionally appropriate and without additives.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie Scott

customer_reviews.title: Consistently enjoyed by our two cats
customer_reviews.text: So far Merrick has nailed it. Both our cats, who sometime seem finicky, never seem to have a problem devouring this brand and flavor. The issue we've had with other brands is consistency. One batch can be fine and the next can be 'turn their nose up and walk away.' The problem is exacerbated if you buy a whole case and end up stuck with something your cats won't eat, and cases are all you buy via Amazon. Again, so far with Merrick, they have the consistency issue handled. Our household is grateful for that. We also have been almost as happy with their salmon pate flavor.
customer_reviews.author: stryder

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: My super picky Bengal who was hooked on fancy feast (previous owner) will actually eat this. Thankfully it is much better quality and it doesn't make her constipated like that evil fancy feast.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Can is not even full
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for about two years, however there's been a sever decline in quality for the recent few months. For the last couple of boxed i bought, the can is not even full, and the food is not very dense. They filled up only about 90% of the can. Considering trying out other brands now...
customer_reviews.author: lfgao

customer_reviews.title: the other eats it because shes hungry but she doesn't really like it. It's a shame because they both loved ...
customer_reviews.text: One cat won't touch it, the other eats it because shes hungry but she doesn't really like it. It's a shame because they both loved Instinct's Rabbit formula and I've been looking for less expensive grain free foods.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: My kittens love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a very densely packed can of pure nutrition, that my cats love. It has just the right amount of moisture to it, and yet it completely satisfies them, and they are "older" kittens now.
customer_reviews.author: E. Redmann

customer_reviews.title: Crushed
customer_reviews.text: Not the first time I’ve received manacled cans in a subscription. This is why I cancelled once before. This is not cheap food.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee lover

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite
customer_reviews.text: Please go to the Merrick website to see ingredients and description, they are wrong on Amazon! My cats love this flavor out of all the other choices. In fact, they have only eaten this one, the salmon, and the duck- no others. Major bummer since I find Merrick to be a good quality brand. Surprised these canned foods don't have more ratings, this is cheaper than what my local stores offer. A significant amount of cans were dented, if not all every order I have placed. That's the only drawback, but the food doesn't seem to have been compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: WHICH PRODUCT ARE YOU BUYING?
customer_reviews.text: First 3 orders fantastic and the quality was outstanding. Last 2 orders quality has been suspect withbthebkast order being a totally different formula.
customer_reviews.author: SeoulMan23

customer_reviews.title: Product might arrive damaged but customer service replaced it
customer_reviews.text: Normally great product. Recently, it arrived and 14 out of 24 cans were badly dented. It took some searching but I was able to get help via amazon chat for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: alina

customer_reviews.title: Great for our kitten!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been feeding our kitten this wet food combined with dry food for about 8 months and she LOVES it - her coat is soft and shiny too!
customer_reviews.author: Megan I. Smith

customer_reviews.title: What I like best about it is it mixes well with water
customer_reviews.text: I buy the Merrick pate canned food as I have a diabetic cat and she needs grain-free food. She loves this brand. What I like best about it is it mixes well with water. My cats don't like to bite into their wet food, they prefer to lick it up instead. I mix it about half and half with warm water which mixes up well and they eat it all up. Very happy with this product, I repurchase it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: At least one can was completely empty and I have to wonder about the food itself since my cat has been hesitant to eat it. I've not had this problem with other varieties of this food before
customer_reviews.author: D. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: All cans were dented, one compromised
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, have been purchasing it for my cats for years, but this time, every single can was dented, despite the case being well protected. The box was not damaged at all so it's not UPS or Amazon's fault. Very disappointed here. One can was compromised and I had to toss it.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice Gibb fan

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great, but . .
customer_reviews.text: We started our extremely picky old cat with a very nervous stomach, and looked good enough to eat. Certainly she loved it. However, the longer we order and receive it, the drier it gets. It's now at the point where if it were ordered for me, I'd send it back. The cat still likes it better than cheaper stuff, but I'm very unhappy about the decline in quality.
customer_reviews.author: seagazer101

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my cat with struvite crystals.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only non-prescription or specialty food that my cat can eat and not get struvite crystals on. I used to have to feed her either prescription wet food or the proplan urinary stuff. Both are filled with crap ingredients and are way more expensive then they are worth. This stuff is still pricey, but it's a little cheaper then the prescription stuff and contains good ingredients so I'd rather give her this.
customer_reviews.author: Resident01

customer_reviews.title: Great cat food!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat really likes this, and I approve of the ingredients. It's also made in the U.S.....which is a good thing. Although it's a pate'....it has just a little bit of texture to it, so it's not quite as mushy as her other brands of pate' food. I think she likes this....even though she is strictly a pate' eater. At any rate....it's a WINNER....in my book, and in my furry baby's book also. :)
customer_reviews.author: Dharma Sky

customer_reviews.title: Great food for an old picky cat!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only food my cat will currently eat. I have tried every flavor that Merrick offers, and while my cat has a few he will sometimes eat (chicken pate, beef pate, salmon pate) this is his favorite and the one he will consistently eat. I like that it has high quality ingredients and is grain free. I've been feeding it to my cat for almost one year, and he still likes it. He is a 16 year old picky man too.
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: Picky Cats love this
customer_reviews.text: My cats love seafood. But they are in Kidney failure. I thought I would try this. They love it. Quick delivery as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Oh! Approved
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this purchase. My kitten Oh! devours his food and I'm happy with the ingredients. I was buying the 24 pack of 3oz cans but Oh! was going through them like crazy, so I figured with the 5.5oz cans we can go a little longer before having to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: W. Franceschi

customer_reviews.title: My cats weren't crazy about it.
customer_reviews.text: Luckily, I feed a stray who isn't picky about what I give him so it isn't going to waste.
customer_reviews.author: Stinky

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: My cat was adopted from a shelter and LOVES this stuff. I've tried to replace it with a few other kinds of wet cat food but he just LOVES this stuff. I barely give him some in the morning and evenings and he will not let me forget to serve it. It's his favorite.
customer_reviews.author: patricia g marshall

customer_reviews.title: hit or miss with my girls
customer_reviews.text: Hit or miss with my girls. Sometimes they gobble it down when they are super hungry but if they aren't very hungry, they don't really care for it too much. It sits for an hour or so. But, my girls are picky so I wouldn't say this food is bad or not a good choice for your cat. One day they love a food and two days later they sniff and look at me "what is this???".
customer_reviews.author: AddictedtoAmazon

customer_reviews.title: The Thrill is Gone.
customer_reviews.text: My cat has been enjoying this food for several years now, Unfortunately I cannot get him to eat the last 2 cases I purchased. Its appearance varies wildly with each can. Some is very dry, others mostly liquid. He smells it and walks away. I am feeding him chicken and mixing chicken and chicken broth into it just to get him to eat as he is 15 and needs nutrition. Will not order this again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried personally but my cat loves it. She puts a spoon full on each bird she brings home!! Must be like a1 sauce
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: so that's a good indicator.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It's cat food, so I'm not sure how it tastes and my cat refuses to tell me. He does eat it every day though, so that's a good indicator.
customer_reviews.author: threadbaresonja

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: suspect food was expired. Purchased previously at reputable business, never looked like this.... seriously suspect this has been sitting on a shelf for 3 years. cat took one bite and refused. The consistency was off, the smell was off, the texture was off. DONT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Salsa

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: My cat has a very sensitive stomach, and is also a finicky eater. Many brands of canned cat food upset her stomach, and she turns her nose up at most. She tolerates this food very well, and seems to really like the taste. The first ingredients are meat (no byproducts), and there is very little grain, so it is quite healthy as well. The price is very reasonable, making this cat food a great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: It's great but for some reason half the time I buy ...
customer_reviews.text: Edit this is the food that I use for my cats. It's great but for some reason half the time I buy it from Amazon the color is just off and this last delivery half of the cans had water spots on the tops and damaged edges I'm not happy so it means that these cans went in this way I guess factory seconds is what Amazon sells
customer_reviews.author: Iva

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but their pates better than most popular brands
customer_reviews.text: Both the chicken and the turkey pates are their good ones. The rest of the cans have way too many carbohydrates. Cats are obligate carnivore, which means they have problems digesting plant products. Companies use fruits, vegetables, and grains to increase their profit margins. Though this brand general doesn't have grains, the fruits and vegetables are still a no-no. Just because they are healthy for us, doesn't mean they are healthy for cats. The chicken pate has about 2.59% carbs, which isn't bad (still not great), while the turkey has about 4.76%. I am still looking for the perfect brand, as this is not quite perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorWhy

customer_reviews.title: Finally the cat food we've been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This is just my 3 cats' favorite food by far. My vet has a list of trusted food brands that are not full of junk and Merrick is on it. I've tried lots of different brands but this is the one my cats prefer by far. It has an almost flan-like consistent. They love the Turkey Pate flavor the best but they like every flavor they've tried. After years of trying out different brands, I'm sticking with Merrick!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Manya Paley

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My cats love it. The label states that it is not filled with corn, garbage, and other fillers. Also mixes great in water. My cats would rather lick their food than bite into it. I mix it with warm water especially after it has been in the fridge. There are never any leftovers in their bowls. Good for cats to get more water into their diet too. Good food makes happy kitties.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it. Same price as Chewy.com
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it and it’s the same price as chewy
customer_reviews.author: mike d.

product_meta.title: Merrick Purrfect Bistro Variety Pack Wet Cat Food
product_meta.description: Color:Brown| Size:(24) 5.5 oz. CansCats thrive on a grain-free diet high in quality protein with moderate fat levels and low levels of carbohydrates. Merrick Purrfect Bistro offers that and more with an assortment of delectable grain-free wet recipes in a variety of proteins and formats.
feature_bullets: Complete And Balanced Nutrition That Adds Moisture And Is A Great Option For Complementary Feeding For Cats
No Artificial Colors, Flavors Or Preservatives

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
